poem:
Title: "Lines from a Headline Bloodied"

Mornings open their wide-eyed news,
a wail of political activists' blues,
Grim tales relayed in black ink,
pushing humanity on the brink.
In the fog of ideas, who's wrong or right?
"Death to traitors, freedom" takes flight.
Yet, truth and love, they cannot sever,
For freedom's true foe is hate's endeavour.
